ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study condition to which participant was assigned
Notes: 1 = Cognitive remediation; 2 = Comparison condition; 3 = Other; 4= treatment as usual; 5= Computers first; 6= CRT first; 7=SCIT

1=Baseline (STARD); 2=Level exit (STARD); 3= Quarterly follow up (STARD);5= Screening; 10= Baseline; 21, 22, 23 = Mid-point 1, 2, 3; 30= End-of-treatment;  41, 42, 43= Follow-up1, 2, 3 etc.; 601 = 6 Month Reassessment ; 602 = 12 Month Reassessment ; 603 = 18 Month Reassessment

ElementDescription: PSE. Delusions and hallucinations syndromes sub-score
PSE. Behaviour, speech and other syndromes sub-score
PSE. Non specific neurotic syndromes sub-score
PSE. Case id represents the "caseness" of an individuals symptoms id should be 4 or more, score range 0-8
PSE. Catego sub-classes and relevant catego class. NB. no's correspond to appropriate sub-class see PSE manual

Notes: 295.0 = Schizophrenia, NOS; 295.1=Schizophrenia, Disorganized Type; 295.2=Schizophrenia, Catatonic Type; 295.3=Schizophrenia, Paranoid Type; 295.4=Schizophreniform Disorder; 295.6=Schizophrenia, Residual Type; 295.7=Schizoaffective Disorder; 295.9=Schizophrenia, Undifferentiated Type
